channel.title: The Cow Shield (Completely Original)
channel.description:
I made this using mostly primatives, and for the text I make a picture of it in paint, traced that, and elluded it to make it fit, but other than that all prims. I did not copy this from someone, I was just messing around in Meta and made a shield. Here it is
YES I DO KNOW THE SIDES ARE OVERWIRED... What happened was I made the basic box that went 3/4 up the sides and instead of trimming it I just copied it and placed it over to finish the edge... stupid yes, but still looks the same. So please ignore the sides because I'm still new to prims and practicing with them. Thank's!
This is what I made... [IMG]http://i562.photobucket.com/albums/ss67/killernoob3/TheCowShield.jpg[/img]
WireFrame... [IMG]http://i562.photobucket.com/albums/ss67/killernoob3/TheCowShieldWire.jpg[/img]
Wielded... [IMG]http://i562.photobucket.com/albums/ss67/killernoob3/TheCowShieldWielded.jpg[/img]

item.title: The Cow Shield (Completely Original)
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

What the hell is with the sides? There should be less than 20 faces for each side, and you managed to go well over 200 from what I can see.

Read full topic

Why did you write “COW” on it? You could’ve just given it cow colors.

item.title: The Cow Shield (Completely Original)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Tribbinator:

Execellent use of primitives on the shield itself, I hope my little tut on your other topic helped to do this!

Have you seen the sides of the shield? I’m still trying to figure out what happened.

@TOPIC - All was good, until i seen the sides of it, then the wireframe seems to go to all hell. What happened there? I mean, the idea itself is nice, and the model is nice, but, the sides, the frame is just over-populated.

Read full topic
